title: IrisDiaphragm
description: This element represents a Diaphragm, positioned trasversally to the optical axis bounded by multiple leaves, usually metal, arranged so as to provide an opening of variable size, which is adjustable by means of a mechanical control.

subCategoriesOrder.ManufacturerSpec: This describes the Manufacturer specifications for this component (i.e., Manufacturer Name, Model designation and Catalog Number).
subCategoriesOrder.OpticalAperture: This element represents any mechanical, non optical device that is placed in the Light Path and spatially modifies the light beam. Examples include, Pin Holes, Phase Rings, Dark Field Stops, Hoffman Modulators, Diffraction Gratings etc. This element can be associated with an optional Optics Turret.
subCategoriesOrder.IrisDiaphragm: This element represents a Diaphragm, positioned trasversally to the optical axis bounded by multiple leaves, usually metal, arranged so as to provide an opening of variable size, which is adjustable by means of a mechanical control.

MaxApertureDiameter.description: This field records the Maximum physical Diameter of the Aperture of this Iris Diaphragm.

Shape.description: This field captures the Shape of the aperture of this Iris Diaphragm.

Name.description: A User-defined Name for this component.

ID.description: A Unique Identifier for this component.

OpticsHolderPosition.description: This field records the position of this Optical Aperture in a Optics Turret.

OuterDiameter.description: This field captures the physical outer diameter of the component

Manufacturer.description: This field refers to the company, research group or individual who built or manufactured this hardware component.

Model.description: This field refers to the Model name or any other designation the Manufacturer uses for this component.

CatalogNumber.description: This field records the Catalog, Part or Serial Number used by the Manufacturer to uniquely identify this component.

LotNumber.description: The Lot Number used by the Manufacturer to refer to a specific production batch or lot for this component.

SpecsFile.title: SpecsFile
SpecsFile.description: This element refers to a PDF file that contains the specifications for this hardware component as provided by the Manufacturer.

Description.title: Description
Description.description: This is an empty element that refers to an Annotation (typically a Comment Annotation that consists of a simple multi-line comment) describing this component.

Tier.description: The tier level of this component.
